Identity.History: The red fox is a widespread species thanks to their varied diet, which helps them survive in all different kinds of biomes. Their fur (obviously) is usually a reddish brown. Their body length can get up to 35 inches long, but their tail can be anywhere from 11 to 19.5 inches longer. Red foxes make their home in a den, be it a hole, cave, or the underside of some building, and a male (dog) and female (vixen) share the den and the surrounding territory.
